bestBHT.bht: The baskets mentioned in this account were not small, but rather large enough to contain a person's body, possibly even used for sleeping in the desert. It is important to note that everyone received a portion of the provision, and no one was overlooked. The disciples diligently collected the remaining fragments and filled seven baskets. This demonstrated the abundant return they received for the loaves and fishes they had spared.

Henry Alford: The basket here spoken of (spyris) was large enough to contain a man’s body.
Greswell supposes that they may have been used to sleep in, during the stay in the desert.
John Gill: Every one had a share of the provision, and that to full satisfaction; no one was overlooked and neglected, and everyone had as much as he could eat.
The disciples, after they had distributed to everyone his portion, went round, and collected the remaining fragments, and filled seven baskets therewith.
They had a full return for the loaves and fishes they spared on this occasion.

bhtAttempts.bht: The basket mentioned in Matthew 15:37 was not a small basket, but rather a large one that could fit a person's body. Some suggest that these baskets may have even been used for sleeping during their time in the desert. Just as in the previous feeding miracle, everyone was fully satisfied with their portion of the provision and no one was overlooked. The disciples were diligent in collecting and filling seven baskets with the remaining fragments, showing that they received a full return for the loaves and fishes they had spared.

The baskets mentioned in this passage were large enough to fit a person's body, possibly even used for sleeping in the desert. Everyone received a portion of the provision, and all were fully satisfied with what they received. After distributing the food, the disciples gathered the remaining fragments and filled seven baskets with them. This highlights the abundant return the disciples received for the loaves and fishes they had spared.

The baskets mentioned in this account were not ordinary small baskets, but rather large enough to fit a person's body. It is even suggested that they may have been used for sleeping during their time in the desert. It is important to note that everyone received a portion of the provision and no one was overlooked or neglected. After distributing the food, the disciples meticulously collected the remaining fragments and filled seven baskets with them. This emphasized the full return the disciples received for the loaves and fishes they had spared.

The baskets mentioned in this account were not small, but rather large enough to contain a person's body, possibly even used for sleeping in the desert. It is important to note that everyone received a portion of the provision, and no one was overlooked. The disciples diligently collected the remaining fragments and filled seven baskets. This demonstrated the abundant return they received for the loaves and fishes they had spared.

The baskets spoken of in this verse were not small, but rather large enough to contain a person's body. Some suggest that they may have been used for sleeping during their time in the desert. Everyone received a portion of the provision and no one was overlooked. The disciples gathered the remaining fragments and filled seven baskets. This reflects the full return the disciples received for the loaves and fishes they had spared.
